oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - Ott Devine - special guests John and Elaine Barrymore
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpt from radio program Sunday Down South, featuring Ott Devine (host), Francis Craig and his orchestra (performers), and special guests John and Elaine Barrymore (actors).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones -- (03:10) Ott Devine introduces John and Elaine Barrymore -- John Barrymore thanks Ott and compliments the band -- (03:35) John Barrymore talks about meeting the Prince of Wales and going to a nightclub with him -- (04:28) Barrymore talks about the theater bringing him back to America -- (05:00) Francis Craig greets and welcomes John and Elaine Barrymore, and introduces the rest of his orchestra to them -- (05:55) Barrymore asks Ott Devine what he thinks about his suit -- (06:20) Barrymore talks about the service during his travels -- (07:15) Elaine Barrymore receives an applause -- (07:40) Elaine and John talk about raising chickens on their farm -- (08:42) John Barrymore reads a line from Hamlet -- (09:12) Ott Devine thanks the Barrymore's for coming on Sunday Down South, mentions them appearing at the Ryman Auditorium, and concludes the program
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Barrymore, John, 1882-1942;
